definition: to whip on/to raise a whip/by ext. to swagger
abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate
variant of 揚|扬[yang2]
whip or lash/to flog/to whip/conductor's baton/segmented iron weapon (old)/penis (of animal, served as food)

sentences.english: In today's society always push people time.
sentences.chinese: 当今社会时间扬鞭催人。

sentences.english: The carter flipped at the horse with his whip.
sentences.chinese: 赶大车的人扬鞭朝着马轻轻地抽打。

sentences.english: Better re-hitch the wagons, fellas, because there is work to be done!
sentences.chinese: 大家伙最好重新策马扬鞭，因为还有工作有待完成。

sentences.english: He urged his horse forward with his whip.

definition: to urge on a horse using a whip or spurs
fine horse/steed
horseback
horsewhip
to guide a horse with the reins/to rein in a horse
to gallop/to spur on a horse/to let one's steed have his head
bridle/reins/halter
variant of 韁|缰[jiang1]
to turn/to turn around/to transfer (funds etc)
reins
horse's head/same as 碼頭|码头[ma3 tou2], pier
to mount (a horse, bike, flight of stairs, rickshaw etc)
to speed along
bridle/reins
to brandish a spear
to get on a horse/to mount
warhorse
